intro: Scabiosa parielii var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features wiry, branched stems that grow up to 30–60 cm in height, often adorned with small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink or purple flowers with five petals, resembling small, delicate butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or alpine beds. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, typically from late spring to early autumn.
